metadata.titel_preek: Sermon 28: God Is All to All

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The communication of the Divine Word (Thought) to the human soul (Ear) through the vehicle of Christ (Sound/Body) to provide total nourishment.

tekstueel_bewijs: the Word of God... chose a body
he placed himself in that body and came down to us
God provided similar food for your eyes
God is at one and the same time light, harmony, fragrance and food

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The Treasury of Divinely Inspired Texts
tekstueel_bewijs: From the treasury of divinely inspired texts
For the human heart, however, God is...
each individual receives it in its entirety

helper.identificatie: The Body of Christ / The Preacher's Voice / Physical Analogies
tekstueel_bewijs: the Word of God chose a body, just as a thought chooses a sound
physical things can help us understand intelligible ones
their eyes had died of starvation
rejects it scornfully as something bitter and indigestible
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is primarily the incapacity of the hearer to 'digest' or 'perceive' the abundance already present.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The hearer's response to the banquet: seeking, rejoicing, and practicing.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The primary program (God giving Himself) enables the secondary program (Hearer rejoicing/acting).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Incarnation/Preaching → Word of God ← Spiritual Blindness

voorbeelden_god_subject: He’s the light of our heart
the Word of God chose a body
voorbeelden_mens_subject: one eats well but digests poorly

voorbeelden: be sure to digest this food properly
Now, here’s what I wanted to explain to you
Understand, savor what you’ve just heard
each individual receives it in its entirety

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Power' (Pouvoir) of the Word to be present everywhere and the 'Knowledge' (Savoir) of this mystery, which then triggers 'Desire' (Vouloir).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Fasting/Hunger) through ~S2 (Seeking) to S1 (God as All).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The Word becomes the 'vehicle' (Sound/Body) to bridge the gap between the Infinite and the Finite.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Moderate; starvation is used as a metaphor for the lack of God.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is deeply theocentric. God is the source, the food, and the one who initiates the movement toward the heart. Human action is a response to an objective, inexhaustible gift.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: One eats well but digests poorly if he hears God’s word without putting it into practice.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: the Word of God... chose a body... and came down to us without leaving his Father.
This food nourishes without ever being exhausted, is consumed but never used up.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The sermon uses physical analogies (light, sound) rather than biblical characters as moral templates.

identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology is a matter of participation in the Divine nature.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the physical analogy of sound to the theological reality of the Word is seamless.
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'already' of the banquet and the 'must' of digestion/practice.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: God is at one and the same time light, harmony, fragrance and food.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Word itself provides the competence.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as starvation or blindness—a lack of the Good.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject of the primary narrative program (Incarnation and Revelation).

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Increase Pouvoir (the Spirit's power to enable the 'digestion').
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Explicitly mention the Holy Spirit as the one who enables the 'digestion' of the Word.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Address the active resistance of the human will (Opponent) to the 'Living Bread'.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: To prevent the grace from appearing 'automatic' or purely intellectual.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: The current structure (God gives -> Man rejoices -> Man acts) is correct.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of theocentric preaching that uses structural analogies to protect the transcendence and immanence of God.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would focus on the beauty of the 'light/sound' metaphors, Greimasian analysis reveals these are actantial 'Helpers' facilitating the Subject's (God's) movement toward the Object (the Heart).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the context of Ps 105; semiotics focuses on the 'engine' of the sermon where God is the primary Actor.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Body of Christ' and 'Preacher's Voice' function as the same actantial 'Vehicle' (Helper) in the narrative of transmission.

appendices.notnotes: The sermon avoids the 'Moralistic Subject-Switch' by ensuring that even when man is told to 'seek', the 'Object' (God) is described as already filling all things.
